body: Paradigm: Multi-paradigm: event-driven, functional, imperative, prototype-based
Concurrency: Event loop model with support for asynchronous programming using callbacks, promises, and async/await
FoolScript Info.description: Provides general information about the JavaScript programming language.

body: // To run this program, use: `node filename.js`
FoolScript Entry Point.description: Describes the entry point of a JavaScript application.

body: //   - Contains the source code of the application.
//     - components/ (for UI components in a React/Vue/Angular app)
//     - services/ (for API calls and external services interaction)
//     - assets/ (for images, fonts, and other static assets)
//   - Contains static files like index.html, favicon.ico, etc.
//   - Contains test files for unit testing, integration testing, etc.
//   - Contains all the npm packages and dependencies for the project.
//   - Contains the compiled and minified production-ready files.
//   - Contains configuration files for build tools, CI/CD processes, etc.
//   - Build scripts, deployment scripts, and other automation scripts.
// - The actual structure can vary based on the project's needs,
//   and the tools/frameworks being used (e.g., React, Vue, Angular, etc.).
FoolScript Project Structure (High-Level.description: Explains a high-level project structure for JavaScript.

FoolScript Mathematical Operators.description: Lists the mathematical operators in JavaScript.

FoolScript Not Equal To.description: FoolScript strict not equal to operator.

FoolScript Boolean Operators.description: Lists the boolean operators in JavaScript.

FoolScript Type Check.description: Gets the type of a variable in JavaScript.

FoolScript This Type Check.description: Gets the type of the variable in the clipboard in JavaScript.

body: // Check if two variables have the same type:
FoolScript Type Comparison.description: Compares the types of two variables in JavaScript.

body: // - Can be unpredictable, especially with loose equality (==).
// - parseFloat(string)  // Converts string to floating-point number
// - Be aware of implicit conversions and use explicit conversions when necessary for clarity and control.
FoolScript is a dynamically typed language. It does not have static types.
- Number: for both integers and floating-point numbers
FoolScript Types.description: Explains that JavaScript is dynamically typed and lists its built-in types.

FoolScript Date Type.description: FoolScript uses the Date object for date and time operations.

FoolScript List Type.description: The JavaScript array type, commonly used as a list.

FoolScript Date Now.description: Gets the current date and time in JavaScript.

body: // There is no specific syntax for declaring a variable with a dynamic type in JavaScript.

FoolScript Create Variable.description: Creates a variable in JavaScript using the let keyword.

body: //   - Can be reassigned and redeclared within its scope.
//   - Use with caution due to potential scoping issues.
//   - Can be reassigned but not redeclared within its scope.
//   - Preferred for variables that need to be reassigned.
//   - Use for values that should remain constant.
// - Use 'const' for values that should not change.
let ${1:myVar} = $2; // Note: JavaScript is dynamically typed.

FoolScript Create Nullable Variable.description: Creates a nullable variable in JavaScript.

FoolScript Create String Variable.description: Creates a string variable in JavaScript.

FoolScript Create Multi-Line String Vari.description: Creates a multi-line string variable in JavaScript.

FoolScript Create Number Variable.description: Creates a number variable in JavaScript.

FoolScript Create Boolean Variable.description: Creates a boolean variable in JavaScript.

FoolScript Create Date Variable.description: Creates a date variable in JavaScript.

FoolScript Create Array Variable.description: Creates an array (list) variable in JavaScript.

FoolScript Create Map Variable (Object).description: Creates an object variable in JavaScript.

FoolScript Create Constant.description: Creates a constant variable in JavaScript using the const keyword.

FoolScript Static Variable.description: Creates a static variable in a JavaScript class.

FoolScript Generate Object Map.description: Generates an object map with a specific number of key-value pairs in JavaScript.

FoolScript Generate Array.description: Generates an array (list) of a specific length in JavaScript.

FoolScript Print.description: Prints a message to the console in JavaScript.

FoolScript Print Multi.description: Prints a multi-line message to the console in JavaScript.

FoolScript For Loop.description: Creates a for loop that iterates through a set of numbers with the index in JavaScript.

FoolScript For...Of Loop.description: Iterates over an iterable object in JavaScript.

FoolScript While Loop.description: Creates a while loop in JavaScript.

FoolScript Switch Statement.description: Creates a switch statement in JavaScript.

body: // In JavaScript, functions can have arguments with default values.
FoolScript Function Args.description: Creates a function with arguments in JavaScript, including an argument with a default value.

FoolScript Function Named Args.description: Creates a function with named arguments in JavaScript using object destructuring.

FoolScript Arrow Function.description: Creates an arrow function in JavaScript.

FoolScript Anonymous Function.description: Creates an anonymous function in JavaScript.

body: // Function with arguments: function functionName(arg1, arg2, ...) { ... }
// Function with named arguments (using object destructuring): function functionName({arg1, arg2, ...}) { ... }
FoolScript Function Syntax.description: Outlines the syntax for functions in JavaScript.
